item.description:
Christchurch Road on junction to go towards TGI Fridays etc

item.title: Subsidence Ryeworth Road, 21st August
item.description:
Outside 40 Ryeworth Road, It was “inspected” a few weeks ago and deemed not dangerous enough. I’m sorry but that is unacceptable. My car (that I pay road tax for) cannot pass the dip now without bottoming out. It needs repairing, not when it gives way like 2 years ago, but now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Ryeworth Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several black litter bags outside the gate to Hucclecote Meadows SSSI, 21st August
item.description:
Litter bags There are several black bags from a community workday outside the gate to Hucclecote Meadows SSSI. This is Lobleys Drive opposite Laxton Road. If these could be collected this would be most helpful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Litter picking bags ready for collection

item.title: Tree very large, 21st August
item.description:
Previous reference 7915696. I received an email today to say that the hazelnut tree reported has been done/cut. However, the wrong one has been done as you’ll see on my previous report. I told you that the tree was behind 358 and 360 London Road. The tree that appears to have been cut is along Chase Avenue. And I’ve said it’s actually in the cul-de-sac behind the houses on London Road (also classed as Chase Avenue) by the garages. So I’m afraid someone’s going to have to come back and cut the correct Hazlenut tree. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 356b, London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged drain cover, 21st August
item.description:
The cover has AGAIN been damaged by the grass cutters, I thought that I had reported it last Tuesday but I can't see any reference to it. This is constantly being damaged in the same way because they just drive the mowers straight over it never checking it is all right. I was in the back of the house when it happened and heard the noise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The condition of the road surface in Church Lane is exceptionally poor. It is more than just potholes, and the whole surface is now crumbling and breaking., 21st August
item.description:
Church Road, Badgeworth. ///elects.fond.speakers Whilst this appears as a country no through road, there is actually a great deal of traffic. The Barchester Badgeworth Court Care Home is accessed off the end of the green and generates a lot of traffic from staff, visitors and medical traffic including ambulances.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 21st August
item.description:
Customer reports that a series of large kerbstones have been left in the verge at location. States they don't look very old, but also there does not appear to be any damage to the existing kerbs at this location, so unsure where they have come from.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waymarker removed from gate and path obstructed, 21st August
item.description:
The waymarker has been removed from the fence/kissing gate at the access to the PRoW off Brockhampton lane and the path obstructed by a field gate further down. This has been done without notice or any apparent application for closure/diversion
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole stretch of Brockhampton Lane from the barriers to The Hyde lane end is in a terrible state. The road is extremely uneven. The most recent repairs are pathetic. There’s a length of tarmac been placed which in itself is extremely uneven, the edges have given way already and the huge dip beyond was untouched and the repair finished to that., 21st August
item.description:
The section on the long straight is particularly uneven and when cycling you are compelled to go along the middle of the road. However recently cracks have opened in the middle of the road which are wide enough to swallow a cycle tyre. Highly dangerous and the same has happpened at the other side of the railway crossing. Is it not time this road was fully resurfaced? Many cyclists go along here in preference to the dangerous Hyde lane. This must be the worst road in Gloucestershire. Please do something!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac Path needs cracks filling, 21st August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Saint Michaels Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 21st August
item.description:
Customer reports that there are cones at the location (and around the roundabout) but no work is being done - they are there for no apparent reason. This has been the case for a while and it is causing chaos. If these cones aren't removed, they will do it themselves.
Report on FixMyStreet
